text: The best Chinese food in Lakeview! I especially love their smoothies, which are fresh and full of real fruit as well as their orange chicken. The place is tiny, however, so I suggest ordering delivery if you're close by.
It's my go-to and I'm a chinese food addict. Great lunch specials as well. Never tried vegetarian stuff but heard it's good.

We were cutting it close to catching a show and needed good food and fast. My boyfriend ordered chicken fried rice (a staple) and I got Veggie Singapore Noodles. We shared two eggrolls and a lychee peach smoothie. The chicken fried rice was, in my opinion, up to standard. My boyfriend really loved it. The noodles were very delicate and had a marinated tofu that was very similar to chicken in consistency. For a while I was sure they had accidentally given me chicken until I tried it and realized it was very delicious tofu. We snuck our eggrolls into the show - and that was awesome. The smoothie was amazing, I kind of wish we had each gotten one. We talked about our dinner before and after the show. Thank goodness I grabbed a menu to take home. We we definitely be coming back!!!

I never write reviews but this place deserves a review. 5 stars for sure!! Best egg rolls in the city, and I love their general Taos chicken (they let me do sauce on the side so it doesn't get soggy on the delivery). Chicken was cooked perfectly and had a nice crispy outside. Friendly staff that is very accommodating and fast delivery. Everything we've tried here has been amazing! Chicken fried rice, eggs rolls, crab Rangoon, general Taos chicken, Mongolian beef. Have never actually been to the place but get it delivered. #lazy Highly highly recommend!!!!
Yummy! Absolutely love it here. Very quick and delicious. The general tso's tofu is amazing. You can taste the high quality of the food. I live close so you bet I will be there again very soon!

Horrible customer service - entered the place to order food. The lady didn't even turn to look at me to take the order. Once turned I asked to pay with Samsung Pay and she said that her machine doesn't take it. I told her that Samsung Pay works on any machine (even if there is only a card reader) and suggested to try. No need to make my meal if it doesn't work, but she refused and became super rude. This business is stuck in the past - glad that she didn't demand payment in gold coins. Still don't get why she refused to even try considering that I used it in 3 different businesses on Broadway 10min before (which I told her)
My go-to take out place. Super fresh ingredients. Honey Lemon chicken, vegetable lo mien and crab ragoons are my some of my favorites!

I love this place. I no longer live in the neighborhood but still order delivery, specifically for their Chongqing chicken (chili chicken). It's the best north of Chinatown. This is definitely not a spot to take a first date unless you don't want a second date. Skip the dining room and get take out/delivery. I haven't tried many items on the menu so I can't provide a comprehensive review but what I have had has been excellent Szechuan cuisine.

Their sign says "Home of the smoothie". Well, I'm happy to report, they did not disappoint in that department. It's a very unassuming looking place, few tables, nothing fancy. I don't know about the food situation here, this review is only about my perfect smoothie. I was in the area, asked Yelp for help, and was happy to learn this place was only 200 feet from where I was parked. It was obviously ment to be. I walked in, the lady behind the counter was nice, and helpful. Believe it or not, but I never had taro flavored  anything before. Boy, have I been missing out! Got my taro smoothie, with tapioca and green jelly (added for $0.45). It was heavenly. The smoothie was honestly the best one I ever had. I'm totally gonna make up excuses to go to this neighborhood all the time to get my smoothie. They also sell 12 different flavors of herbal tea, fruit cups, milk tea, Thai iced tea. Their smoothie list has 24 flavors to chose from. 5 stars for the smoothie, and service. You think I said the word smoothie enough in this review? No? I didn't think so either. Lol.
Super greasy but reliable Chinese food. The roasted pork lo mein and crab rangoon are my go-tos.

Meh...  I had the Mongolian Beef. It was bland, other than the abundance of white onions. My daughter's Thai rice was also bland.  It was cheap, and it tasted like it. It's not horrible but it's definitely not special either.  You can skip this one.

Food was outstanding. Korean chicken is expertly spicy and the chicken was perfectly cooked. Vegetable lo mein was light and flavorful. Egg rolls are the best I've had.  Locally owned too!! Highly recommend.

Used to be our favorite until I waited 20 minutes in the restaurant for our pick-up order to be ready, 50+ minutes after we placed our order.  Not even an apology, a kind word, or anything comped.  Not sure we will be back...

I was reluctant to try this spot only because my usual spot is like a block from my house, but they were closed yesterday so me and my girlfriend decided to try something new. Man oh man, this food was sooo good. I had the veggie Egg Foo Yung and is was delicious. I will be bold enough to say the best I've had...ever, and I've been a fan of egg foo yung since a kid. The sauce was really good and had a flavor I've never experienced before with Egg Foo Yung. I'm excited to try other dishes from this spot now. Grade A in my book!
BEST eggdrop BEST egg rolls GREAT Mongolian beef GREAT Smoothies (I prefer mango)  Some of the other things are lacking in flavor but overall definitely my go to spot!
Average food, 1hr 20min wait for delivery, and two hairs in our food..... portion sizes are pretty good

We liked Yummy Yummy quite a bit, definitely one of the best Chinese restaurants we've had that delivers to our place. We ordered the fried dumplings, sesame chicken, and orange chicken. They were all quite good. The sesame chicken was a bit too sweet, but still pretty good overall. The orange chicken had actual orange peel to season it, and the dumplings were great. Will definitely order from again.

Ew. I had a not so savory experience here yesterday. I was walking by and I saw a sign on the window that said "Home [or House] of the Smoothie." Since it was a whopping 81 degrees yesterday, I figured I'd stop in. When I walked in - EW. Smelled like Chinese food mixed with smoothie smells. And then, there was something overhead at the door that was whisking the smell around. YUCK.  Against my better judgment, I ordered a mango smoothie - mostly because they had mangos lined up on the shelf, and I was sure that the ingredients of the smoothie would be fresh.  My first issue is that the gal operating the cash register, and who took my money, never bothered to wash her hands after handling the cash I gave her, and answering the phone. She just went right to putting her bare hands all over the mango. THEN, THENNNNN, after she blended the mango, she took the blender over to the sink and started running tap water into the mix. WHAAAA. Oh hell no! I was pretty horrified that she didn't wash her hands and that she was mixing tap water into the mix. It was a waste for me. I tossed it in the first waste basket I saw and walked the long trek to Jamba on Belmont. Never coming here again. Never ever.

When I'm in the area and if I'm craving for bubble teas, I always go to this place. Their bubble teas are made of fresh fruits which is a  to me and they make sure the tapioca are very soft. I only tried once to dine-in but the owner is very nice. Food was delicious! I would recommend this place if you're craving for some high quality chinese food

Love the food. I ordered from here three times now in one week and have been very satisfied.The portions are huge and the food is delicious. I had the Chicken Lo Mien and the General TSO Chicken. The Chicken fried rice was very good too. The Orange chicken was yummy. Delivery was fast.

I order take out from here often and it always comes hot and quick. Honey crispy chicken is to die for! Not too greasy and the chicken actually tasted like it was chicken. Quality ingredients make this place great. Vegetables lo mein is more like a spaghetti (but I'm okay with that) noodle but the flavor is everything. The lunch special is a steal, you get so much food. I love this place!!! Highly recommend.

The best! I've been a regular customer for the past two years, this place is my go-to takeout restaurant. I always get crab ragoon and the broccoli with chicken (and add cashews). It is soooooo good, I'm too satisfied to try anything else. Their portions are massive!! You will have leftovers. The interior of the restaurant is small, hence why I always get it to go. This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in the city.
The food was fantastic, it was hot, great spice level and reminded me of living in the Bay Area! Thanks for the good food at a reasonable price!!!!

So I've been coming here for a few years for some really important reasons: I'm lazy af and this place is 5 minutes away, compared to Miss Asia down on Diversey they have bigger portions and are cheaper, and they're just good! I usually stick to the bubble teas, dumplings of all kinds, and noodles, to be clear. I get a little picky about my Chinese food being from the SF Bay Area (and just being snobby in general), and this place serves its purpose: fast, cheap, flavorful, and great proximity to my sloth-like existence.

I've been going here for a while just for the smoothies. They are so fresh and delicious! This past weekend I decided to go for the food and was BLOWN AWAY. My friend and I ate there - it is a small place but we figured why not. We ordered the egg rolls, the crab rangoon, egg foo young, and the sesame chicken to split. Everything was amazing.

This isn't a place that I'd go if I wanted authentic Asian food, that is for sure, but its got great bubble tea! I actually speak Mandarin (我会说中文) and spoke with the owner a bit and she was one of the nicest ladies I think I've ever encountered. They are a very nice Guangdong family that are running a very popular American Asian food restaurant. Overall I loved the service and the boba but for someone who has been to Asia a few times, I'm not too big on American Asian food, but there's was better than I was expecting!

This was my first time ordering from here and I was very excited, however I just found most of it to be okay rather than great.  Delivery was about an hour, which I thought was good, and the food was still hot when I got it.  The crab rangoon are very delicious, and the egg rolls were good but they had shrimp in them. I'm not sure why that is such a big thing in Chicago, i've never heard of it before moving here.  My beef and broccoli was bland and had a little fishy taste to it which I did not enjoy. The wonton soup was good, but very different than any other wonton soup i've ever had. The broth was almost clear and had snow peas and carrots in it. I will probably give them another chance, but only if I can't find a place I actually love.

Went all in for the 5 because of the humongous egg rolls! Ordered the crispy sesame beef (favorite), general tso's chicken (mmm, not that spicy) and chicken fried rice (tasty, large hunks of tasty chicken). It was all exactly what you'd want from a stand by Chinese take out place in the neighborhood. Shout out to the restaurant staff, they were moving the Friday crowd politely and swiftly!

Yummy Yummy knows that your food can only be as good as the quality of your ingredients and their ingredients are FIYAH. Easily the best fried rice I've had in Lakeview. Like. Easily.  It's the little neighborhood Chinese cuisine I've wanted all of my adulthood.  Their meat tastes like meat instead of cardboard and the flavor of their vegetables is always savory and the presentation of their food is also thought out and writing this review solidified my dinner plans so see you tonight, Yummy Yummy!

My favorite local carry out /delivery spot for Asian food. They never disappoint. Every dish I've tried there over the years has been made to perfection. Also, love their fruit smoothies in the summer especially.

Yummy Yummy is one of the cutest and easiest names for a Chinese spot! Now I haven't indulged my Chinese cravings in quite awhile as I've been on this weight loss journey thang. But Sunday...I needed it. I couldn't make it through the day without some deep fried, delicious Chinese. Their Crispy Honey Chicken has a sweet & sticky light sauce. Taste was okay but seemed extremely garlicy and not enough honey flavor...I was also hoping for it to be a bit more creamy sauce. Their sweet & sour chicken was pretty standard, not amazing in flavor, pretty thin sauce. However in both my dishes, the chicken was done just perfectly,  Ah well. For carryout orders, they package the sauces separate than the meat which is always great so things don't get too soggy.  Their Crab Rangoon was spot on and the best thing of my meal! I'd recommend that and trying a dishes other than what I had.  I'm not totally counting out Yummy Yummy as they have a million dishes but I'd try something else on my next visit. And since it was all just alright, I'm in no rush to grab food here again anytime soon. A swing and a miss!

Best little Chinese restaurant you'll find in the city. You can just tell they really care about their business by being very attentive and making sure everything is perfect for you. Anytime I want Chinese this is where I'll be going

So I'm giving Yummy Yummy 5 stars even though I didn't like a couple of the things I have ordered/ tried. The reason being that the things I did like, I reaaaaallllly loved. Like a ridiculous amount. Namely, THE HOT AND SOUR SOUP. It's easily the best I've ever had. I crave it all the time now. Get it! My first order was for delivery, which arrived at my house in about 35 minutes, though I do live about a 10 minute walk away. I got: - Vietnamese egg rolls - Japanese dumplings - small hot and sour soup - crispy sesame beef - general tso chicken - pineapple smoothie - kiwi smoothie The Vietnamese egg rolls were meh. They were fine, but definitely wouldn't get again. The Japanese dumplings were very good, and even though it said only 6 came in the order, 12 ended up coming. So don't know what the deal is there, but appreciated it. The crispy sesame beef was... very good. Solid. Not fantastic, but interesting and well done. I was hoping it would have some sort of other flavor, but it was overall just pretty sweet. If you like sesame chicken, try this. The general tso wasn't spicy! I was pretty disappointed. I suppose I could try again and ask for extra spice, but I was really sure that there would be a little kick to it. I figured the crispy sesame beef wouldn't be hot, but it would be a nice contrast to the general tso that I was sure would be spicy. I was way wrong. The smoothies were awesome- particularly the kiwi. Fresh and delicious and just all around solid. Plus- big! So the last but not least- THE HOT AND SOUR SOUP IS MY NEW FAVORITE FOOD. It's DELICIOUS. I devoured the small one I got, and actually went back 2 days later and got a large one. It's just perfect. It's easily the best hot and sour soup I have ever had. When I got the large hot and sour soup (walked there and got take out), I also ordered a beef egg foo young- together it was about just under $16. The portions are incredible. The egg foo young comes with 3 giant hunks (I'm used to only getting 2) and the large soup is ginormous. I am so happy. Get the hot and sour soup!

I had the chicken fried rice and my boyfriend had the chicken lo mein. Both were delicious! The delivery was super fast and our food was hot when it arrived. It was pretty inexpensive and you get a lot of food for your money!

Found this place on a whim and was extremely surprised and happy. It's definitely no frills on the inside but you can tell they know exactly what they're doing. Would absolutely go back and recommend to anyone looking for delicious Chinese in the area.
Delicious vegan options and great smoothies. Their delivery time is great too. High recommend!

I've only ordered takeout from here. For the most part the food is good. Healthier tasting that a lot of other Chinese takeout. Smoothies are great too. Prices are fair, I guess. The staff can be a little moody. I always ask when I order to hold the MSG. They always say they don't use it but that won't stop me from asking.

Really good food. They just took forever. My husband and I ordered from here on New Years day and we waited for over an hour for our takeout order. They don't have a good system of knowing when they have taken on too many orders.. and they keep taking new orders even though they can't fill the ones they already took.  So honestly really disappointed about the service - especially for takeout where the bar is already so low.  But the food was really good. They did mess up our order and give us sweet and sour chicken instead of general tso, but it was still good.  So i would give this place a 3. Don't go if you are in a rush, or if you really are set on eating what you ordered... Can't promise either.  But the food is good. Some of the best take out chinese I've had in a while.

Inexpensive, quick service, tasty food, and great for vegans. Been meaning to come here for a while and it did not dissapoint. Tons of options for everyone, including soups, stir fried noodles, wontons, dumplings, curries, and stir fries. The vegan options are seemingly limitless! There are few vegan food options I'd be willing to share with friends, but I can certainly add this one to the list.  Service may not be the best, but it is absolutely fitting for the restaurant and even adds to its appeal.
Fixed me needs for fast delicious Chinese. Beef style Seitan and broccoli is a dream come true. Please stay here forever, yummy yummy.

this place has amazing food! I wish it were closer. They had amazing tofu so it's definitely good for vegetarians. They had like a Korean style BBQ tofu, fried tofu. The sauce was amazing. pretty spicy so be prepared. It was a little bit pricey, they didn't have any side dishes like Korean places normally so I had to buy a side of kimchi which was more expensive than I would have for sure. would love to come back to try more options!

I've been eating at Yummy Yummy for years! I'm obsessed with their bubble tea and their Szechwan Shrimp is also very delicious. Very flavorful and the shrimp is cooked perfectly. I order delivery occasionally and my food always arrives hot and my smoothies are always cold. My favorite bubble tea flavors are Strawberry/Lychee or Mango/Pineapple. I would definitely recommend ordering from Yummy Yummy.

I was so excited after seeing the positive reviews for this place's vegetarian fake chicken dishes, hoping that I had finally found the perfect place for chinese take out near me! Unfortunately, I couldn't even finish my sesame chicken dish as the texture and flavor were truly disgusting. I've tried many different fake chicken dishes at many different chinese restaurants, and I honestly have know idea how this happened because this was nearly inedible and was so very disappointing. Really too bad.
It's a small restaurant on Broadway street. Mongolian beef is soooooo good. Environment is sweet.

Pretty good quick service Asian style food. Has all of the standard dishes that your traditional Chinese takeout spot would have. They're extremely fast - I usually phone in my order and start walking over (maybe a 10-15 minute walk) and it's ready by the time I get there. This is my go-to Asian takeout spot.
Go to ordering place.  Great and flavorful food that always seems fresh.  If you happen to be passing by stop in for a smoothie.
Absolutely favorite Chinese in Chicago! Healthy options, always quick service, and huge portions!!
Delicious fresh bubble tea! Shrimp fried rice and shrimp lo mein were so tasty. Not greasy. Nice staff. Short wait. Happy customers
Food is very yummy and the flavors are always consistent. I recommend the orange chicken as they include real bits of orange peels so you know it's fresh!
Nice quality white meat chicken in the Orange chicken.  Great smoothies with fresh fruit!

I love Yummy Yummy! It's a great little spot in Lakeview East. I've never eaten in the restaurant, but I get take-out from this place fairly often. The people who work there are great, and there's always patrons sitting in for a meal or carrying-out so a good stream of customers. They have an awesome lunch special where you get the soup of the day, egg roll, and entree of your choice for a little over $7. The food here is different from other Chinese spots. It doesn't give me that gross/ate way too much feeling when I'm done enjoying my meal. Highly recommend this spot! Food is yummy and portions are generous; everything you look for in a go-to Chinese resturant.
My go-to Chinese delivery spot. They are yummy (no pun intended) and quick. The Li mein is awesome. My sister is a vegetarian and said their tofu options are great. Enjoy!

You will have a meal, and then some for the next morning, afternoon, evening, or whenever you need more Yummy Yummy Asian Cuisine. Why four stars? It's good, but I've had better quality. Still very...yummy.
Finally after two years of living in the city I have found my Chinese food! Tonight I ordered Kung Pao Chicken, egg rolls and vegetarian wonton soup. Everything was fresh and delicious!
I love this place! The best take out places in the area. I would recommend the chilly chicken and the wontons.

so so so yummy! This is my go-to spot for take out. They have a huge menu and are vegetarian friendly. They have a really extensive vegetarian menu. The chap chae is a stand by for me, it reminds me of homemade. And I always get the general tao's chicken, it is so good.

You cannot beat the price and quality of the food here! They have the best Thai Basil Shrimp Fried Rice I've ever had. The smoothies are also great as well. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the food is always ready quickly!

Big enough portions for sharing, delicious food, good prices, and a large vegetarian/vegan menu. (There's a liquor store on the same block too, for BYOB.) Melody on the River (I don't know how to describe it, it's almost like fried mashed potatoes? Crispy outside, smushy, comforting taro inside) is everything! Scallion pancakes are a great appetizer too. I'm a vegan and the staff was very accommodating and answered all my questions. The dining area is small and there's no ambiance so it's not a place you'd want to take a date, but I would bring friends here in a second! I will definitely be back.
A great place for excellent Asian food. One of the best and fastest places for chinese on Broadway. Small and simple restaurant.
Uses higher quality ingredients than most Chinese fast food joints. Love everything I've ordered so far including the egg rolls, smoothies, Mapo tofu, and general tsos chicken

Love this place! This is my go to restaurant when I crave CHINESE FOOD! The staff is always super nice and friendly. One time we had to wait a longer than usual time for our food and they gave us a free smoothie!
Kung pao soy.  Hands down awesome.   Just wish it was a little more spicier.   Best scallion pancakes and dumplings I've had in a long time as a vegetarian.  Small but absolutely good food.

The food is great and it gets fairly busy on weekends. Been a regular here for a few years now and they have a good selection of vegan/vegetarian food. Their watermelon smoothie with tapioca is a must try if you are a fan of watermelon! But, they could definitely use more help in service.

The soup here was amazing miso and the wonton but the main dishes were insanely salty.  Couldn't even eat my dish.  I am sensitive to salt sometimes but the amount of sodium in these dishes were off the charts.  Really wanted to like this place but can't.  3 star is a lot for this place go and try the soup at least.  To top it off I clearly didn't enjoy my meal and they made us pay for it.  Very bad business.  Had to change it to 2 stars.

Big portions which were really really good. We came here on a busy saturday night and didn't wait for more than 15 minutes. We did have take away thoug, so can't really say anything about the waitering.  So priceworthy!
Phenominal, had last night. Clean Chinese food and VERY flavorful, cant wait to go back.

This review is for the smoothies. They are fantastic! The real fruit really shines through in flavor, and is not covered up by too much sugar or cream like other Chinese smoothies/bubble teas I've had. You can get it with tapioca or jelly, or without. We got the avocado without, and our friends got the lychee strawberry with tapioca. Both tasted great!

The best word I can think to sum up Yummy Yummy's food is unoffensive.  I've had some takeout, both Chinese and otherwise that have ruined my entire existence for at least a day and a half. Not the case here, so I will give Yummy credit for that.  I ordered sweet and sour chicken, while my friend had sesame chicken. We both had an egg roll and split a fried rice (all for a very reasonable price). I ended up eating more of his entree than mine. I thought it would be spicier, but it was still good. My chicken, on the other hand, dry and a little tough; I had to drown it in its sauce to make it work. We both concluded that the rice and eggrolls were decent.  So yes, unoffensive. There is no reason why I wouldn't order from them again, but I can't say that I'm in a rush either.

Ever eaten at one of those divey taco stands your friends say is to die for but you try it and swear you're going to die afterward?  This is the Chinese version of that taco stand.  Next time you're looking for Chinese, think of Nancy Reagan, and "Just Say No" to Yummy Yummy. Yucky, yucky.  I've given this place too many tries, and each time my experience grows progressively worse.  Oily egg rolls that taste like they've been fried in five day-old grease, chicken fried rice with a nauseating fishy taste, and chicken satay served with a brown sauce that looked lumpy and congealed.  Anyone who claims this is the best Chinese food in the city might want to check out the 500 other Chinese restaurants scattered around.  Both Jin Asian and Eat First on Belmont are two places that I highly recommend.  (note: Jin Asian is a remarkably better experience if you want a casual date-night place or somewhere to impress relatives from out of town) I wanted to like Yummy Yummy because the people are friendly (though comically understaffed) and the location is relatively close, but for excellent fried rice and satay I'll stick with Joy's Noodles up the street.
Always a pleasure to eat here;  They have an extensive vegetarian menu and the bubble tea is on point!! It's small but i like that it's not a huge and noisy. portions are BIG and service is great

By far the best Chinese food in Chicago. I love the orange chicken ask for the egg fried rice to go with it only two dollars extra. You get lots of food and you'll have plenty of leftovers. I highly recommend this restaurant.

I haven't had Chinese food in a while so I decided to pick some up from this place for lunch right before the Euro Final.  The place is pretty small but was actually very busy with a lot of people dining in as well as grabbing smoothies.  My boyfriend go the crab ran goons which were pretty big but I didn't try them since I don't eat seafood.  We also had the orange chicken, mangolian beef, chicken friend rice and lo mein.  The mangolian beef was awesome and definately some of the best I've had.  The only thing we did not enjoy was the orange chicken because it seemed to lack sauce.
Got the orange chicken, which was YUMMY, the egg fried rice which was YUMMY, and the strawberry kiwi frozen bubble tea which was YUMMY YUMMY. Definitely recommended.

This is fantastic Chinese take out. I had the hot and sour soup and orange chicken. The name is well deserved it is definitely Yummy! If you love great American Chinese food this is the spot. They were very busy and still sent out quality stuff. It is a LARGE portion for dinner. There was also a super cute guy getting takeout... So happy this place is around the corner from where I live. Good food and maybe I'll run into that cute guy again.

This place is pretty much one of Lakeview's best kept secrets. It's a cute little small, unassuming place in the crowded Broadway stretch three blocks East of Clark. I wasn't expecting much when, during a lunch break at work I ordered some food from here. Boy, I was blown away with how good the food is! I now, eat lunch here almost weekly, although I shouldn't admit to eating out that much, but it's true. I've tried many of the dishes and have yet to have a dish that wasn't, well, yummy! Honestly, you can't go wrong here. I'm pretty much hooked, it's ridiculous. The green thai curry, the pork fried rice, the moo shoo pork, so good. I try a new dish each time I order and so far so good. They also have smoothies that are equally as Yummy. I've ordered from many other Asian restaurants in the area and this little place is hands down the best in Lakeview. As I type this I'm about to order from them lolol.
This is the best cheapest chinese place i've been to. Huge meals, low prices, fast service and all great choice of tasty smoothies. Love this place, it's good !!!

Best Chinese food ever! Always impressed with the fresh veggies and the selection of items. The staff is kind, and the food is always ready for pick up in 20 minutes or less. Once you go yummy yummy you can't go back.

This was Chinese food. It tasted like your everyday Chinese food. If you are a vegan you can get something, if you're not you can also get something. I quite enjoyed the peach smoothie with tapioca. Yum.

I was really hoping we would love, or at least like this place, as it's right around the corner, has a pretty extensive menu and I love having a local Chinese joint to go to regularly. However, given the food on our first order we won't be back. We ordered the crab rangoon and shrimp fried rice, two pretty straightforward dishes which are tough to ruin...somehow they managed.  The crab rangoon was so bland, it was like there was NO seasoning or salt in it whatsoever and the "cream cheese" had no flavor like that at all, and the texture was really off. Kind of gelatinous rather than creamy, I mean it was a disaster.  The fried rice was quite blah and they use those tiny little cheap frozen rock shrimp, which isn't the end of the world and to be expected on a menu this cheap, I know, but we had to really doctor up the rice to want to bother...bland, bland, bland.
Fast delivery, very tasty crisp General Tso chicken. Pancakes were very warm. Will be eating from here again in future. This is now my go to Chinese Food..
Great little place! I was especially impressed with the BBQ Seitan appetizer. Only complaint is that the scallion pancakes were a little doughy.

Love this local place! Ordered the green curry tofu fried rice, egg roll & my boyfriend ordered the sweet & sour chicken & crab rangoon. he loves coming here! Food was ready really fast, the employees were very friendly and food was delicious!! Would def order from there again

I was helping a friend move to a new apt and late in the evening we decided to order take out from Yummy Yummy. Not too bad, it was pretty average Chinese take out. We ordered crab rangoon, egg rolls and sesame chicken. Each dish was nice and it hit the spot. The order was delivered quickly and he was very friendly.  If you feel like having chinese take out in Boystown, this should be your place.

I moved to Chicago 4 years ago and I have been utterly disappointed by every Chinese place I have encountered until now. Yummy yummy is a tiny spot that has the best Chinese food I've had I Chicago hands down. I can vouch for the General Tso's, Sweet & Sour chicken, and vegetable Lo mein. Can't wait to try more dishes... The portions are incredibly generous as well. I have now had delivery and picked up. Delivery was hot and quick.

Best Chinese food in the area, by far. I've been searching for a decent moo shu pork and this is pretty good, not perfect, but outshines anything in the area. They have a HUGE variety of Asian food.  Lunch specials are giant. It comes with soup and an egg roll. I had the basil shrimp. I can appreciate when a restaurant gives the appropriate ratio of protein to vegetables in a lunch portion. In other words, the shrimp were plentiful. The vegetables were cooked to perfection (I hope so since they are known for their veggie menu). Szechwan chicken dumpling were awesome. Garlic, spicy, sesame, ginger deliciousness sauce. I feel like the dumplings were just plain old steamed pot stickers, but regardless, they were delicious.  The boba is on another level. Best one in the neighborhood. Green jelly or tapioca if you want and the flavor options are limitless.
The food at this place is always so good & fresh! And for the drinks-The taro smoothie is my favorite.

Unfortunately, I just did not like what I got, which was the pad Thai noodles. Maybe other menu items are better. I probably won't try it again to find out. There are plenty of places in the area I would try for the first time before giving this place another go.

Delivery service is extremely slow. Some of the worst I've had in Chicago. This is the second time I've waited well over an hour for my food to be delivered. Gave them a second chance because scallion pancakes are my favorite and hard to come by on menus around the Lakeview/Lincoln Park area. Offered no compensation either time despite the extensive wait time. I normally am not a yelp reviewer, but if you are ordering delivery definitely consider this review if you are remotely hungry as you will be waiting quite some time.
er...my roommate and I's mutual friend said she found plastic in her drink once...that's all I'll say.

First time ordering from Yummy Yummy.  This is the best Chinese food I've had in years.  I had a few specific requests and my food was delivered exactly as I requested.  Delivery was very fast and the servings were very plentiful.  I would highly recommend.  I ordered mixed veggies (I was very specific in what vegetables I wanted and they gave me exactly what I wanted), General Tso's chicken, shrimp fried rice (specially requested with egg) and egg rolls.

Its hard for me not to get the same thing every time I go. I get the Spicy basil chicken noodle, no chicken. Its jalapeno, basil, chinese broccoli with wide rice noodles. its my JAM!! TINY place. Seems like most of the business is takeout. They always hustle and do a great job.

Ordered their vegan hot and sour soup, spring rolls and mapo tofu with brown rice.  For some reason, I was really hungry today and devoured the most of the food.  The soup was perfect.  I LOVE their tofu, it tastes so fresh.  I still have some mapo tofu that I'm looking forward to having for dinner.

If you're looking for some amazing Singapore Noodles, order them at Yummy Yummy!  I've found that finding a good rendition of these noodles is difficult.  Sometimes the noodles are too wet - sometimes the noodles are lacking curry.  At Yummy Yummy, they are fabulous!  Just the right amount of curry, mixed with shrimp, pork and green peppers.  So delightful.   The menu is pretty extensive and has a little bit of everything - from spicy Korean beef, to scallion pancakes, salt and pepper shrimp, mooshoo pork!  It has the traditional "American" staples, but also throws in different items that you might not see so often.  It's also the one place in the 'hood that has bubble tea readily available now.  Plus! The seating area is small, so I usually get orders to go.  But I have come by during lunch time and seen the place packed!  I think they offer a great priced lunch special, so that's always welcomed when you don't want to drop too much midday.

I definitely recommend this restaurant to all in the area. They have fast and efficient service and the food is great! My personal favorite is their soups, I look for spicy items and they don't disappoint.

Inexpensive, fast, delicious. Can't get enough of this place ! Never been let down by any of the food. This place is not fancy by any means but doesn't need to be. The food says it all. Their smoothies are delicious (I order them even when it's -5 outside). They also have a wide array of vegetarian options if you're in to that kind of stuff. Definitely my go-to for Asian food. ALSO HUGE PROPS TO THE LADY WHO ALWAYS WORKS THE COUNTER. SHE IS A MULTITASKING ANGEL LADY

Very delicious, with excellent options for herbivores, Yummy Yummy features more authentic Chinese food than most of what you'll find in the USA. Nothing on the menu has ever disappointed, and the Taro smoothie is surprisingly good! We try to eat here every time we're in Chicago (which is not often enough)!  Vegan wonton soup, several variations of "fake meat" which can be used in place of real meat in most dishes, and so many other great options that you never see in typical Chinese places. Small dining area but you don't usually have to wait for a table. Good service, too...our favorite Chinese place in the city!

I live very close so this is my chinese place of choice when the craving hits; usually Sunday nights when Im hungover. It always satisfies and had close to a billion options, including vegan options if thats what you're all about. I stick with the sesame chicken and fried rice which is A+.

Ate in here one Wednesday night. The inside area is very small, probably only has seating for about 16 people. The service was good, as was the food. Good vegetarian options, although we had meat selections. Will be back.

I REALLY wanted to like the food, especially when the delivery came so quickly.  It came so quickly I wondered how the staff had had time to cook my order. I'm wary of pan-Asian menus: is it ever true that the Thai and Chinese are equally good?  Or that the sushi is as good in its way as the pad thai? Some of Yummy Yummy's food struck me as cynically prepared.  The Tom Yum soup was so salty I couldn't eat it.  Its smell and appearance verged on vile.  The vegetables were unevenly cooked.  The mushrooms bobbing on the top were raw.  I ended up discarding the soup uneaten. The veggie steamed dumplings, egg rolls, and basil rice beef were subtly flavored. The dishes from the regular menu (rather than the vegetarian one) contained almost no vegetables and were heavy on starch, which is why they're so cheap.  The chicken pad thai had no vegetables in it (not even bean sprouts), only chewy pieces of fried tofu (which I hadn't asked for).  It was just a big blob of noodles coated with a grainy orange substance that probably came from a jar. Figuring out which dishes from this restaurant suit my taste would be daunting, unpleasant, AND expensive.  No thanks.

I live within a five minute walk from this Chinese place and I have to say that it's a cheap, tasty, and a convenient option! I am someone who eats out a lot so this was exactly what I was looking for. The food wasn't overly salted or greasy as well. I'd highly recommend the fruit smoothie drinks here. They use real frozen fruit and the boba was nice and soft.
Go to take out spot, favorite in lakeview! The Crab Rangoon is so good I have to order it every time!!

Still do not understand why this place got 4 stars. We had take away couple of days ago. Very nice staff but the food was not good. My wife had crispy tofu, I had tom yum kung and red curry. This is the kind of restaurant who will serve super hot and spicy dishes to hide the lack of flavor. The tom yum so diluted and so hot that I did not enjoy it (I usually love hot food). The curry was a piece of strange gooey gel, with soft vegetables and some odd moist soy pieces, tasting like old chicken - very strange and not enjoyable. Skip this place.

This was my go-to place when I lived around the corner in E. Lakeview. I can't find any decent Chinese takeout in current neighborhood, so was happy to know they deliver to River North! Wonton soup, egg rolls, crab rangoon and sesame chicken were all yummy yummy. Large portions, one entree is enough for two people or you'll have leftovers for at least another day.  Wonton soup had a lot of dumplings, but it was missing bok choy and green onions :  ( Love their sweet and sour sauce for the egg rolls. I recommend for delivery or quick carryout! *They also have all fruit smoothies, which are refreshing during summer months if you are just walking by.

About as good as you can get.I had all the Korean fare. Kimchi, Kimchi beef stew which was very similar to JJigae , and Korean beef. Pretty amazing flavors. Extremely busy place but the staff really were up to the task. I hear a lot of complaints about "it's not vegetarian"! I have a retort. Whaaaaaa. Go to a vegan joint and eat that crud. 3 is my highest honor i can give while still living. I really enjoyed it.

I have had several meals here and have enjoyed both of them.  The menu is huge and most of what I've tried has been tasty!   The prices are super cheap and it's BYOB so I always leave full and surprised at how little I've spent.  Don't come here for the ambience or for a romantic date, just come to eat some delicious and cheap chinese food.  Most of their business seems to be carry out, as there is always a stream of people coming in when I eat here. They only have a few tables. Tip- Try the Kung Pao Tofu, it is awesome!   They have a pretty extensive vegetarian menu if that's your thing.  Also particularly enjoyed the beef chow fun, shrimp with broccoli and sesame noodles.

I really wanted to like this place. The food was okay. The service was also not that great. Second time here! The first time, the woman at the front did not she like she cared to take my order & then, would forget what I ordered. Second time, today, the servers didn't really ask if there was anything else that was needed & just kind of ignored or would seem bothered when approached, even if it was politely. Asked one of the people working there for water & they just kept walking. We waited & waited for a server, so just stood up & got the water pitcher ourselves. BUT, I do have to admit that the boba/bubble tea is quite tasty!

Hands down the best Chinese food in Lakeview.  The egg rolls and wonton soup are my go-to. Service is always quick and friendly for pickup or delivery.  I highly recommend this place if you have a hangover (wonton soup) or even if you don't and just need a Chinese food fix. Love this little place.

I've eaten here a few times and both times have been to my liking. Note, I've only gotten take-out. The actual restaurant is very small. They have a very large menu! I like their website - it makes ordering very easy. It is a smooth process and I haven't had any problems with their system. Best food ever? No, but it's good, you get big portions, and the price isn't bad.

I got the Mongolian Beef, which was very good. The beef was tender, and the sauce was slightly sweet - very nice when mixed with rice. Also got the egg rolls, which were crispy and had substantial contents. Good flavor as well. Will definitely be going back.

A great delivery Chinese place! I ordered Chinese food here earlier today and the service was very fast, the food was very good, and the portions were huge. The delivery price is cheap (I think it is for $2, a lot of places are more) and the man who came with the food was very nice. Definitely ordering from here again!! Thank you yummy yummy!

Yummy Yummy quickly became my favorite carry-out and delivery place, not only because their name is fantastic, but the food is on point.  Some of my favorite dishes: Basil rice with pork, pad thai, all the fried rice dishes, orange chicken, general tso, sweet and sour chicken, pot stickers, and crab rangoon.  I do want to give a special shout out to their marvelous egg rolls! SO GOOD!

Just have had some tea and smoothies here but for the area, the price is very affordable for the quality of food. The shop itself is fairly small and it seems like the two owners and sole workers are husband and wife. They really care about their customers having a good experience, and humorously, were really surprised when my brother and I spoke some Mandarin to them. I guess that doesn't happen all too often with their clientele ha. Regardless, good people and good food.
Really unexpected considering the appearance of the place, but the food is amazing! Especially the fried rice. Would highly recommend.

I went here because of all the great reviews. Yes they have real fruit smoothies, except for coconut the flavor, which is the one I got. As for the food, freshness texture and temperature are awesome. Unfortunately flavor was missing from the fried rice, as well as the crispy honey chicken.

My bestie and I ate here a few days ago and we got a lot of food. The crab ragoon was the best I've had in a long time. Lots of real crab with phili. cheese and not greasy. The beef was tender and we got fortune cookies- score! All the food WAS flavorfull except the wonton soup, which was a bit of a disappointment. Aside from that this is my new favorite chinese place in the area. Quick tip: the place is very small with limited seating. On a busy day, you will easily sit next to strangers close enough to slap them with your chop sticks.
Great food but the kitchen is hidden and I have seen a cockroach run across the floor :/ food taste good if you want a vegetarian option for Chinese. They should invest more in cleanliness though...
I haven't had the food here, but the bubble tea smoothies are good! The mango/lychee is delicious, and so is avocado.

I recently revisited yummy yummy and had a much better food quality experience. I stuck with tofu on the general tao. However, I did order the  vegan bbq seitan appetizer and it was great. I also tried tapioca for the first time in a pineapple smoothies at the recommendation of the waitress. Service quality definitly needs a patient patron, so just realize if you are in a hurry carryout is probably a better option.

I moved to the neighborhood and gave this place another shot -- I have returned several times since.  So glad I gave Yummy Yummy another chance because I am now obsessed with their bean curd in garlic sauce...it's so good.  I recommend ordering carry out, as the location is small and nothing exciting.  Best vegan Chinese in the city!

I come here at least once a week, especially since Chicago has been warming up for the summer. They have the best smoothies and bubble tea. My favorite is the thai ice tea with tapioca! Delicious and reasonably priced!

Always great to get lunch or dinner from Yummy Yummy! I've worked and/or lived relatively close for 8 years and it is my go-to for General Tso Chicken and miso soup. I've turned several friends and family members into fans as well.

Close to where I live :) Came here twice, once for pad thai take-out and once for smoothie. Both was good for the price we paid. For smoothie, you could pick what suger level you want ( you could also do this at most asian smoothie place, such as Joy Yee or Tank Noodles) I'll come back again!
I always stop in for bubble tea, but there's usually only 2 people working so sometimes it can take a while but the prices are decent. The mango bubble tea and green tea bubble tea are my favorites

Don't waste your time. Don't waste your money. I just finished a meal here and I was very disappointed. I got the General Taos Soy Gluten meal. And an order of egg rolls. The portion size of the soy gluten balls was decent, but there were not enough vegetables even though I paid and ordered extra vegetables. Also, whoever said the soy gluten was delicious, was lying. It's not. It's dry. And it's fried. So not very healthy. Perhaps there are other options on the menu that are better... I spent $17 that I could have spent somewhere else. Just being honest.

Yummy Yummy is amazing! Tosn of vegetarian options, but they also have a full menu of regular Chinese food options. I go all the time for smoothies which are wonderful. This place is an old favorite, I crave it all the time!

Solid Chinese take out with fast delivery. Chicken dishes use nice large chunks of breast meat.  Known for their General Tso.  I prefer Shanghai Inn, but they're closed on Monday's and have a small delivery zone.  Give this place a shot if you're in the nieghborhood.

Best fruit smoothies!! It can be hard to find a place that makes tasty fruit smoothies without milk and if you are allergic to dairy like me this is the place to go! They are so good and they have a ton of fruits to chose from! Also the food is good and tasty but my main thing are the smoothies with tapioca... I didn't like tapioca before this place but, they converted me !!

Very misleading restaurant! The sign and menu says "Vegetarian Health Food." But only PART of their menu is vegetarian. They fed a vegetarian in our party real chicken. The dine-in ambience is uncomfortable. The bathroom is thru the kitchen which is a very insanitary design. Skip this place!
Great chinese food, reminds me of San Francisco!  I love that there are vegetarian choices, although I would love to see more asian vegetables featured.  But I'll take bok choy over broccoli anyday!
Suprised with all the positive reviews..  The seitan dishes are flavorless and overpriced..  The spicy basil rice was soggy and flavorless  Sesame seitan balls were sweet lacking any flavor

Yummy Yummy. Amazing taro coconut bubble tea and sizzling chicken soup. But from Earth's point of view: positives: they serve their to dine-in customers with washable silverware and plates. like a normal restaurant. negatives: Most of Yummy Yummy's business is take-out and all of their take-out containers are not biodegradable/compostable. Yummy Yummy serves dine-in bubble teas in 24 oz. plastic to-go cups and the shop does not offer a recycling bin for that waste. Please consider serving your dine-in customers their bubble tea in real glass cups instead of disposable plastic. Also look into compostable and biodegradable plant-based options for your carry out containers! The neighborhood and the environment would be pleased!
Stopped here after work for take out.  The service was pretty fast, everything was ready for pick up when I got there. Everything was reasonably priced.  The food was just ok. It was nothing special.

So disappointed with this place.  The Mongolian Beef is just dry beef (not sure if they put the sauce on) and the fried rice is flavor less (and not really fried).  So disappointing!  However, delivery was fast.
Delicious food, reasonable prices, quick delivery, and always excellent vegetarian choices.  They happen to be very nice people as well.

This is for the former fans of Yens looking for a new go-to Chinese place. This is it.  Ordered for the first time last night (Friday) around 5:30. It's not far from us (and Yens) and they have a ridiculous number of vegetarian options-seriously, you've never seen a menu like this before. We had crab rangoon (great flavor, thicker shell, flatter shape), scallion pancake (kinda blah-I'd skip it), shrimp lo mein (light on veggies, not much sauce, but noodles had excellent texture and shrimp was super fresh and I loved it), eggplant in spicy garlic sauce (tons of fresh veggies, sauce not TOO  sweet) and special chili chicken (crunchy bits of goodness, no sauce at all, but delicious white meat chicken in a super flavorful coating).  Phone ordering was straightforward and food came in the time promised (45 min) and beautifully packaged. We also got a lychee bubble tea freeze, which softened a bit during delivery, but froze right back up in the freezer while we ate and it was perfect after dinner. So, this is my new go-to place and I'm super excited about it. I'm ready to order again. Check it out. And enjoy.

They have some of the best Asian food in Lakeview, in my opinion.  My husband and I live in East Lakeview and have tried just about every Chinese food restaurant within walking distance, and they have the best-tasting food by far.  I love the combination fried rice and General Tsao's chicken.  Sometimes the service is really slow for carry out when you get there to pick up your food, and their cash register seems to be from the 80's, but the food is really good!
I ordered the General Tso, shrimp fried rice and Crab Rangoon.  The food was really good. No complaints, delivery was quick. This will be my usual spot.

Great food! Walked in & ordered food to go. I got egg rolls, egg drop soup, sesame chicken, & Mongolian chicken. Everything was hot & delicious. The only downsides here are that I didn't get any crunch noodles to accompany the egg drop soup (I'm accustom to this so maybe this restaurant just doesn't give those with the soup?). The other negative was that people came in to dine in at the restaurant & ordered their food after us, yet they got everything they ordered before we got any of our food. I'll definitely go back & would recommend it!

SERVICE: Terrible. Called to check to make sure they'd received the online order after the confirmation email had said "ASAP" for delivery time and an hour and a half had passed. The lady asked me to hold while she checked four times asking for my address each time yet you could hear her in the background answering other phone lines and giving them updates. Finally she came back on, asked for the address again and said "We'll deliver it soon, thanks bye" then hung up. FOOD: Mediocre at best. After over 2 1/2 hours of waiting it finally arrived. It's a good thing I'd pretty much lost my appetite at this point because it was a major let down. The egg rolls were amazing, but that's where the buck stopped. We ordered the General Tao's Chicken and the Szechuan Beef with String Beans. Not the best, but not the worst.  All in all, there's plenty of other options in the neighborhood that I'll be trying before I order anything other than the egg rolls from here again.

Well I placed an order at 7:23 pm, and I am still waiting for it to arrive at 9:48 pm.  I know it's Valentine's Day but for the love of God man!  I called at 9:00 and was told they were "packing up my order" and since then they have stopped answering their phone completely.   I'm fairly hangry right now and have no V Day love for Yummy Yummy. update:  10:04 and still no delivery.  I did finally get through to someone and they told me 5 more minutes and offered 20% off next time.  HahahahahahahahahNO.  There will be no next time Yummy Yummy.

I rarely take the time to write a review, but it looks like tonight will be a first. I see three other reviews tonight about the poor delivery service and I'm here to write another. 2 hours for delivery and the food was cold. Told me they would give it to me for half price but I'll be calling tomorrow asking for a refund. I just can't stand when they say "we are almost there" three times in an hour. Just tell me you are way behind and ask me if I want to wait. I'm hot hungry at 11PM...just tired.
The best Green Tea Boba in Chicago. Hands down. Amazing lunch specials for vegetarian options. Get the Mongolian Seitan or Empress Seitan. Nice people, great service, great food.

It's just okay.  I ordered the sesame chicken, roasted pork lo mien and Vietnamese springrolls.  The roasted pork had good flavor but the lo mien on the whole wasn't fabulous.  I like lo mien with a generous coating of soy sauce based sauce.  These noodles were naked, no sauce.  It also was lacking in vegetables.  There were just a few onions, snap peas and hints of bean sprouts.  The Vietnamese springrolls were weird. They lived up to the bad reviews I read on Yelp before I tried the place. The roll was loose and the contents was the wrong consistency. It was like mush, couldn't tell what was pork and what was vermicelli.  I'm relatively new to Chicago, been here a little over a year. I've been looking for good Chinese and have tried a few places that weren't great. I'm adding Yummy Yummy to that list.
The best chinesse restaurant in the are. I work close by and order lunch from yummy couple times a week. The fresh smoothies are THE BOMB! Also , they have great lunch specials.

I love Asian foods and of all the Asian restaurants I have tried in Chicago for the past 4 years this place will be in the top 3. Quality food. Family owned. Plenty of options. Perfect taste and pretty affordable. Quantity of the food is sumptuous.

I don't understand how this place has so many good reviews. I got delivery and the meat made a squishing sound and took the form of breaded styrofoam. The most disgusting food I've ever had. The fried rice was overcooked and the crab Rangoon's tastes old and not fresh.

Standard American Chinese fare, lots of choices.  Service is friendly, and food is quick.  We ordered takeout and it was ready in 10 min.  The Szechuan sauce on the green beans and pan-fried tofu was too sweet for my liking and the sweet and sour chicken was mostly sweet, not sour.

I love love love this place. I could seriously gain 10lbs over the weekend eating some yummy yummy food. My favorite combo is the hot and sour soup, and an order of egg rolls, and an entree. It's all good, it's all cheap, and it all fast! The staff here are great! Very friendly. I don't normally dine in, but it's not that kinda place.
This is one of my favorite spots... Delicious food, really friendly staff, and uber efficient delivery! Love their seafood combo, and smoothies! Highly recommend checking this place out!

Was somewhat ok to eat it with both eyes closed, except the food lacked freshness and seamed like all was made of cans or frozen packages.  All of us felt sick later on.  Not mentioning the funny or ZERO ambiance in the restaurant itself. The telephone was ringing non stop, people were lined up all over the place... it is more as a PICK UP place for to go orders.
The House Special Chili Chicken is my everything.  Amazing vegetarian menu, too.

Just moved to Chicago and was looking for a replacement for my college days Chinese place. This was good! Delivery is $15 minimum, which is good for those of us who live alone and loathe large minimums for delivery. AND first time orders got 15% off so I was able to get a smoothie too :) I ordered sweet and sour chicken, potstickers, and a pineapple smoothie and was impressed! Everything came in its own separate container, so the chicken was crisp not soggy and I was able to choose how much of the sauce I wanted. It makes it easy to avoid soggy leftovers as well! The potstickers were delicious! Smoothie was good as well, but was a little watery. Food arrived within 25 min of ordering. I will be ordering again next time I'm looking for some classic Americanized Chinese food.

As a Chinese food addict, I am always looking for a cute local place to sit and relax and enjoy good food. I was very impressed with the vegan-vegetarian friendly menu. I asked for no MSG (as I always do at any restaurant) with no problem. Everyone was so friendly and kind. We ate in the restaurant but it could have been my living room because we felt relaxed and well taken care of. Will definitely be back to support this great local business.

I got an orange chicken lunch special that came with rice, soup and an egg roll. And then on top of that I got a strawberry and banana smoothie with tapioca for $11. If you're looking for cheap Chinese food-- this is the place. Asian food all taste the same to me, this was pretty good. I've had better but it does the job just fine.

They use MSG in a number of the items on their vegetarian menu items. Shame on them.  We went home with MSG headaches and more. Too bad because the food is tasty. Vegetarians want healthy food. When ordering from a vegetarian menu one should not have to instruct them not to include MSG. The person who confirmed my fears that there was MSG in the food said it is in the soy sauce. It is easy to get soy sauce without MSG, and that is what they should do
Really fresh, really good Chinese food. Love the pork with eggplant and spring rolls.

I'm a vegetarian and I just moved in around the corner from Yummy Yummy. I was very excited when I walked by and read the menu because as a vegetarian I've given up dishes like Mongolian Beef and it's hard to find hot and sour soup not made from beef stock and vegetarian potstickers. I came in for lunch and went a bit overboard when I ordered scallion pancakes, veggie potstickers, and the Mongolian seitan lunch special which comes with a veggie egg roll and hot and sour soup. My favorite was the scallion pancakes. I always love those. Enjoyed the rest in this order: hot and sour soup, potstickers, Mongolian seitan. The soup was pretty good. No complaints. The potstickers were alright, not bad, didn't love the texture of the dough. Almost forgot the egg roll- standard, not bad. My issue with the Mongolian seitan was that maybe I don't like seitan.  Haven't had a lot of it as far as I can remember. This seitan had a kind of fishy taste on the inside. I didn't like it. I'll come back and try a different veggie protein in a different dish. The rest of the dish (mushrooms, onions, scallions) was fine. They forgot to give me a rice choice so they gave me white, I would have asked for brown. The waiter was not very attentive- I ordered the apps and asked for a minute to figure out the rest and I ended up having to go up to the counter to order the entree. And he forgot the soup at first but remembered after I got the entree, not a big deal. Looking forward to finding an entree I enjoy, hopefully next time!

Incredible Veg Chinese food! In my opinion the bill tends to add up quickly for a mostly take out type restaurant, but the portions are HUGE! My go to favorites are the soy gluten chow mein, empress soy gluten, vegetarian won ton soup and the jack fruit boba smoothie. Also, during the week they have really affordable lunch options that I love. Yummy Yummy is so worth checking out.

I'm used to a variety of flavoured milk tea boba drinks but I would get the fresh fruit smoothies with boba drinks here any day.  They use only fresh fruit and the strawberry, mango, lychee, and red bean coconut smoothies are all amazing. Chinese food is also really good. This is our go to place. Delivery is quick and food is always consistent. Orange chicken or general tso's chicken, chicken lo mein, and mongolian chicken are our favs.

First, let me say. I LOVE CHINESE FOOD. Since I moved from Michigan, it has been a struggle to find Mom & Pop type Chinese restaurants. All you ever see in the city is the Asian Fusion or Sushi places. I've been pretty loyal to Emperor Wok for years, but I recently discovered Yummy Yummy on a suggestion from a friend, and I must say, it is DELICIOUS. We just ordered takeout for a group of us and everyone was pleased. I got the Sesame Chicken and a side order of Crab Ragoons. Others got the Chop Suey and Mushu Pork. Everyone was pleased. The portions are great and the service is pretty fast. This along with Emperor Wok are my 2 "go to" Chinese places in Chicago.

I came here on recommendation from my sister for their fruit smoothie bubble tea. I honestly had no idea what a bubble tea was and so I was interested to try it.  It's basically a fruit smoothie (chopped fruit and ice) poured over black pearl tapiocas. I tried the avocado flavor while the others with me had watermelon and cantaloupe. We all agreed that avocado was the best. Bubble tea is supposedly sweeping the nation, and I would happily return to Yummy Yummy Asian Cuisine to have it again.

At inside Yummy Yummy last night. Yes, it is super small but there were only a couple other people eating there too so it wasn't a problem. Service was great. We didn't know exactly what we wanted to order so the waitress told us to get the sesame chicken and crispy beef. Glad we did! It was some of the best Cantonese style Chinese food I have had in the city. The potstickers were also a good choice. Would definitely do take out from here next time I have a craving!
Delivery was quick. Crab rangoon, Szechuan Beef, and miso soup were all delicious

One of the best takeout experiences I've ever had.  Food was much better than would be expected from a place like this, service was great for a take out place, I was half a block away after picking up and the woman chased me down the street because they forgot to put the sweet and sour in my bag and threw in an extra order of egg rolls because she felt bad.  Very low risk and thats important for places like these that can be hit or miss.

I've been here three times and all have been fantastic.  The place is tiny but almost no one eats in, so don't worry about getting a table.  Every dish includes white rice. The egg foo young is three huge patties with delicious gravy.  I got the combination style and it was loaded with shrimp as well as chicken and pork.  I've never had better. The sweet & sour chicken was perfectly crispy and served with the ruby red sauce on the side, so no worries about it being soggy.  The portion is huge, almost too much for one diner. The orange beef is fantastic.  I got it carry-out and it was still hot 20 minutes later.  The meat slices are perfectly sized, the breading is just right, and the sauce is outstanding, with small pieces of orange peel in it (some good, others bitter, so you may not want to eat it).  There was also broccoli but that's not my scene. Their smoothies are great, on a hot dine-in day I saw several people walk in just to get those alone. I can't believe how many times I was just steps from this place on a trip to Crisp and never saw it.  I've lived in Lakeview for 12 years and this blows away any other Asian cuisine I've had.

I had the pleasure of experiencing Yummy Yummy for the first time a few weeks ago, and the name speaks for itself... it was truly Yummy Yummy. Being a vegan it can sometimes be difficult to find resturants that have a lot of food that cater to our specific needs, but your resturant does just that. I was glad to find out that Yummy Yummy is also in Arizona which is my home town (super excited). More people should try their meat-free and vegatrian options, I promise you there are just as yummy if not more than those with meat in them! For more recipies and ideas if wanting to go more to a plant-based diet, I highly recommnend that you check out  chooseveg.com !

Basil chicken and sesame beef are my favorite dishes, but what's got me addicted are the bubble teas. The ingredients are always fresh (e.g. fresh mushrooms not canned) and the service is super fast.  I get take out or delivery 90% of the time, the place just really isn't built for an dine-in experience.

This is my "go to" asian restaurant.  They have huge portions and resonable prices.  Some of the best sweet and sour chicken around.  The family who ownes this is very friendly and provide great service.  The smoothie machine can be a bit loud though.
The food is delicious and fresh. It's relatively cheap for take out, and the portions are very big. By far my favorite take out in the area.

Veg menu is one of the best and they have separate kitchens for cooking meat and for strictly veg. Food is excellent as is service but be aware that the space is small in case you're bringing a large group

It was hot. I had a taste for bubble tea, and a half hour to burn. So Yummy Yummy it was for me. I picked up a mango and lychee bubble tea. I also only had a credit card, so fortunately for me they waived the $6 minimum credit card fee.  The bubble tea was quite good, and refreshing to boot. The lychees are out of a can (although to be honest, I can't tell the difference between canned and fresh lychee). The mango, though, was fresh. So I got a great sour-sweet bubble tea for only about $4.50.  Not sure when I'll be in the area again, but I would try other things on the menu.

This place as good tasting food - though not very traditional Chinese. I like that they have a lot of vegetarian options, and I love their sze chuan wontons. My only critique is that their dishes are a bit oily.

Yummy Yummy does standard Asian Cuisine and does it well. Prices are average, the food was good, but in a food city like Chicago (and especially in the Lakeview neighborhood), it wasn't a stand-out. As a Jewish girl from St. Louis, I crave many of these menu items regularly and it hits the spot consistently. Amy I dying to come back? Nope. But will I? Probably.

Pretty good! Ordered for delivery. Food was still streaming hot and fresh. The chicken dumplings were awesome. The General Tso's and Sesame Chicken were really good too. This will definitely be our new go-to for takeout.

This is only for the bubble tea - DELICIOUS!!!! Best I've ever had and I've basically hit every single bubble tea place from south Missouri to here. I got the watermelon bubble tea and it was perfect. And the tapioca balls were the perfect consistency and tasted so sweet and awesome.

This is only in regards to the boba drinks. I came here for boba with a friend after we had already gotten dinner. The drinks were huge, but sadly they only have blended drinks. I got an avocado smoothie and it was pretty good. The boba (tapioca) itself wasn't great, but overall, the drink was tasty. It was also more reasonably priced than other boba places in the area in relation to the size of the drink. I'll probably be back.

Great smoothies, especially the milky ones. The blended ice is so smooth and satisfying. Take out is also decent, fast, and will surely satisfy a Chinese food craving. I like their real protein products a lot better than the seitan. The seitan was a bit too chewy and gluttonous for my liking.

We were in town for a Conference and wanted Chinese so I found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. It was late and we were a large party but despite that we had great service and the food was fresh and  tasted amazing!

Amazing doesnt begin to cut it! The food is awesome. We had a variety of dumplings and these we're the best I've had in the US!  Don't look for ambience when you come in here but prepare to hunker down and eat one of the most delicious meals you've had in a while.

I love Yummy Yummy! All their food is great and they have a great vegetarian, tofu, soy protien/gluten selection. I especially love their Sesame Cold Noodles, seriously they are great, I like to have them make them really spicy and that makes them even better. The inside is quaint and seats maybe a dozen or so people (Good thing, decor is nice and offers a nice quiet dining experience), staff is friendly and delivery is usually right on time or early. I just wish they were open later! :D

I stopped in on a Saturday night with friends for Boba tea.  Judging by its size, this place is very much more of a take out destination. I'm convinced the "1" on the "Maximum Occupancy - 16" sign is a typo because this place is...let's just saaay...cozy.   I ordered the mango Boba smoothie and it was passable. Unfortunately, the mango flavor wasn't very strong so before I knew it, I had already slurped up half of it in my search for more flavor. However, the Bobas were well made - they were firm yet soft and yielding like miniature black Nerf balls.   Service was good. Our Boba drinks came out fast and the cashier didn't condemn us by giving us that usual disapproving "You don't have cash?" look when we paid for the $4 Boba drinks with credit cards.   This is a decent place to get Boba tea on the North side if: (1) you can't make it to Joy Yee's in Chinatown or (2) it's an emergency and you've got the shakes because you don't just want Boba tea, you NEED Boba tea...to live.   In conclusion: Semi-Yummy but not Yummy Yummy Boba tea.

Really enjoyed this place, i got the shrimp and chicken pad thai, it was really big and tasted great, the egg roll was really good too, and the smoothie was excellent as well, i will definitely go back, it's right near the landmark century, good prices too

Came in five minutes before closing time to order a $4 taro freeze that I had to pay for with a credit card bc I was out of cash. They couldn't have been nicer about it. And the taro freeze (with tapioca balls): UH-mazing! You made my night, Yummy Yummy Asian Cuisine!

We ordered Yummy Yummy for delivery which was pretty fast.  We had crab rangoon for an appetizer which was really good.  I was a big fan of the sauce that was served with it.   Entrees were sesame beef and general tao chicken.  The chicken was better than the chicken, but both were delicious.

Although Yummy Yummy isn't doing anything radical with Asian cuisine, it's a great neighborhood Chinese restaurant. The portions are very large, and they have excellent vegetarian options. I enjoy both the sweet-and-sour eggplant and eggplant in garlic sauce. The eggplant in garlic sauce is packed full with other vegetables as well and full of flavor. I never dined in at Yummy Yummy, but their take-out service is always quick. From the looks of it, I don't know that it would be an ideal restaurant to eat in as there are only a few tables. All in all, Yummy Yummy is a great, affordable, neighborhood Chinese restaurant with plenty of tasty options on their menu.

Ma Lowd this place is amazing. This is the best Chinese food in the city. If you'r a veggie this restaurant is going to take over your life. they offer soy protein and soy gluten which is the most delicious thing in the world (its fake chicken and fake duck). I personally think the best food here is the cold sesame noodles, soy protein lo main and the garlic and broccoli dish.

First time I have tried this place. We had Sweet n Sour Chicken (very dry), Egg Foo Young ( worst sauce EVER super sweet), Shrimp with Lobster Sauce ( it was okay but barely any shrimp), and Egg Rolls ( those were good). I ordered online and the total was $32. When the delivery guy got here it was $36. I argued and showed proof of the original bill and was informed that they charged me $4 extra for subbing fried rice on the order. Really??? Why wouldn't they call me regarding that? Unfortunately we didn't have enough cash to tip. Last time I will order from here.

not sure if the food is good or not. But i went last night for the first time, i waited for more than 30 minutes. The lady at the counter just ignored us, totally ignored! She kept talking on the phone for the delivery order. There were 2 guys at the counter, none of them were taking our order. I hope they see this and change the way they manage their shop. The other customer was mad at the lady.

Me and a friend wanted to try Crisp, but they were packed and nowhere to sit so we walked across the street to Yummy Yummy. I wasn't sure I'd like it, but they live up to their name. I had the orange chicken lunch special. It was delicious. Decent sized portions and fairly priced. My friend had the beef and broccoli and that was also tasty. This place is very small inside, but the staff was friendly and attentive. We were the only two eating there, though. I will have to go back one day.
Very friendly and good service. Yummy fruit smoothies! We ordered the hot and sour soup, miso soup, Indian curry and chicken pad thai. No complaints! Very good!
Definitely some of the better Chinese in the neighbourhood. My go-to. I've not had a bad order yet.

This is the best bubble tea / fruit smoothie / stuff tapiocas in my mouth until i can't find my tongue joint I've tried in Chicago. Plus it is that rare place that makes vegetarian food taste good. The soy gluten is something I would go out of my way to eat.
Basically your typical Asian hole in the wall restaurant. Serves bubble tea and Asian food. Not spectacular and not bad. Good for the average fix.

LOVE their food. The place is about half vegetarian and half regular Chinese. The veggie food is awesome, sweet and sour "pork", lemon "chicken", it all tastes so good. They also make bubble teas/smoothies that are quite tasty.

This place is just around the corner from us, but somehow, we hadn't managed to check it out in the 6mo we've lived in Lakeview East.   Glad we changed that last night! The place is *tiny* (seriously--sign on the wall says "max occupancy : 16", and clearly most of their business is carry-out/delivery orders.  I am not sure if we caught them on an off night, because they were very discombobulated about service, but the food was quite good. I am vegetarian, my boyfriend is not.  I'm quite happy that they had a menu that was suitable to us both.  I ordered fried tofu for an appetizer, vegetarian hot and sour soup, and the Peking Style Tofu (tofu in a brown--maybe black bean type--sauce, broccoli, carrots, pea pods, water chestnuts, bamboo shoots, and baby corn.  i had them leave out the mushrooms).   My soup came out first and HOT does not begin to describe it.  It was melt-your-face-off hot. I love h&s soup, and I'm always happy when I can find a veggie version (no meat broth or bits of pork or whatever--you'd be surprised at how varied it can be), and I love spicy stuff, too.  But this was SO hot.  You could sort of get the flavor out of it, but mostly you just tasted BURN.  I wasn't able to eat much and packed the rest to take home, intending to eat it with some rice in it to cut the heat a bit (doesn't reheat terribly well, just FYI.  ok, but not really good).    Then my entree came out.  Mind you, neither my bf's appetizer nor mine has come out yet.  I waited a few more minutes for his food to come and in the interim, my fried tofu appetizer came out.  So I had all of my food, he had none.  So he started nibbling on some of the veggies from mine (no prob).  A couple minutes later, his food came out, and we went ahead.   The fried tofu was plain, but good.  A HUGE portion for the price--definitely something I'd get again.  Really, most of the time, with something like this, it's all about getting the texture nice and having a decent dipping sauce, and this fit the bill.   My entree was probably one of the best sauces, best prepared items I've had at Chinese or Thai places since moving to Chicago a year ago (not counting the awesome curry noodles I've had a couple places, but that wasn't really a sauce dish...), so all the flubs in service were given a bit of a pass.  My bf said his meal was also quite tasty (General Tso's chicken), but his appetizer STILL had not arrived.  Eventually, they came and asked how everything was and if we had everything, and we let them know it was missing, and it came out a couple min later (pan fried dumplings). Between the two of us, our bill was about $35, and my bf has at least one dinner left (though I'll need to make more rice--no biggie!) and I've got two or three meals worth.  Pretty good value for money and absolutely worth eating! (which, you know, you can't always say!)  We'll definitely be back, though it might be take-away.  They seem to have a better handle on that :)
Love this place! Best Chinese delivery that I've found in lakeview by far. The food is always delicious and they deliver quickly. I just wish they were open a little later..

Delivery... don't do it. That simple. We ordered for two on a Sunday night, so we expected to wait a bit. Little did we know we wouldn't be eating for 2 1/2 hours. They told us it'd be about an hour, which is totally cool. However, a little after an hour we called to check on the status and were told they hadn't been able to get to our order and it would be an additional 30-45 minutes.
